December is officially here, which means it's time to heat up some hot chocolate, sink into the couch and get cozy watching everything new on Paramount Plus this month.
Paramount Plus Premium for $2.99/month
Get Paramount Plus Premium for just $2.99 per month for the first two months. You get sports, original dramas and comedies, Showtime shows and movies, a livestream of your local CBS channel — all without ads (excluding live programming).
The parade of new arrivals begins with the streaming premiere of the action-comedy "Guns Up" (Dec. 1), which stars Kevin James as an ex-cop turned mob enforcer whose plan to go legit hits a major snag On the unscripted side, the documentary "Predators" (Dec. 8) arrives to examine the complicated legacy of Dateline’s "To Catch a Predator" with an in-depth look at the reality TV show.
Finally, the psychological thriller "Little Disasters" makes its debut. Adapted from the bestselling novel, it stars Diane Kruger and Jo Joyner as two friends whose friendship is tested by one fateful ER visit. Below, you can find a complete list of everything that’s new on Paramount Plus in December 2025.
New releases on Paramount Plus in December 2025: Top picks
'Guns Up'
Ray Hayes (Kevin James) is an ex-cop who has a double life as a family man and a mob enforcer. He’s finally ready to leave the criminal world behind to open a diner with his wife, Alice (Christina Ricci), but his "one last job" goes very wrong. Now, with his plans ruined and the mob after him once more, Ray has to figure out a way to protect his family while navigating his exit from the criminal underworld for good — while doing a little bumbling around, of course.
Premieres December 1 on Paramount Plus
'Predators'
Director David Osit turns his lens on one of reality TV's most controversial series in "Predators". This provocative documentary takes a deep dive into an investigation of Dateline’s iconic "To Catch a Predator," exploring some of the show’s complicated and often disturbing methods. It questions how things got done, the show's impact, and the cultural changes from the series that ended up inspiring vigilante justice and beyond.
Premieres December 8 on Paramount Plus
Get instant access to breaking news, the hottest reviews, great deals and helpful tips.
'Little Disasters'
Diane Kruger and Jo Joyner star in this psychological drama adapted from Sarah Vaughan’s bestseller. It follows four women bound by a decade-long friendship, until a single incident looks to set fire to their bond. Jess (Kruger) rushes her baby to the ER with an unexplained injury. The attending doctor happens to be her close friend Liz (Joyner), who ends up having to make an impossible choice. That sets off a chain of events that reveals to the pair that even the closest of friendships could end up being turned to ash.
Premieres December 11 on Paramount Plus
